item.title: 24 Days of Hanzi
item.description: Preface 24 Days of Hanzi for Christmas 2020, originally published in Twitter. Day 1 #24DaysOfHanzi 咖 Have you noticed that 咖 is pronounced kā in 咖啡(kāfēi, coffee), and gā in 咖喱(gāli, curry)? I didn’t notice until yesterday, though I already knew. Human brains are funny devices. The word 咖喱 doesn’t sound much like the English “curry”, to the point that for long I’ve had a misconception that garlic means 咖喱. Now that I know 咖喱 is the phonetic translation of the Tamil word “kari”, I feel much better.

item.title: Every Static Blog Engine 1 - Gatsby
item.description: Preparation I installed NodeJS 14 LTS with package managers.On Windows I installed scoop. On Mac I installed brew. Install gatsby-cli Installing gatsby-cli appears to be smooth on both platforms. I saw no error on both Windows and Mac. npm install -g gatsby-cli npm install is quite slow in China. There are Chinese NPM mirrors. If you don’t want to use the mirrors, you can use VPN to speed things up.

item.title: Famous Chinese Go Amateurs
item.description: Here are a list of famous amateur weiqi players in China. Note that people stronger than 5d aren’t included. Mao Zedong. According to an article, Mao zedong and Zhu De played weiqi in JingGang Mountains. They were using a hand drawed paper goban, didn’t notice there were 20 lines until the end…. General Zhu De. See above. General Chen Yi. He has always been carrying a small 13x13 goban with him, even when fighting on the battlefield.
